intro: Cryptantha ambigua var. echinella, commonly known as the spiny cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are often covered in fine hairs, and the flowers appear in clusters at the ends of the stems. It is an annual plant that blooms in the spring and is sometimes used in restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil.
